title: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: The 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes, such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc. These obfuscated class names make it difficult to navigate and find the desired classes.
OB: When opening the 'All types' dialog, obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' are visible.
EB: When opening the 'All types' dialog, only non-obfuscated classes should be visible, and they should be sorted in a way that makes it easy to find the desired classes.
SR:
1. Open the 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4.
2. Verify that obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' are not visible.
3. Verify that only non-obfuscated classes are visible, and they are sorted in a way that makes it easy to find the desired classes.
